title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for first point

1 point is earned for second point

1 point is earned for third point

1 point is deducted for each additional point or incorrect point

Absolute maximum at x = 0

Absolute minimum at x = ±2
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for first point

1 point is earned for second point

1 point is earned for third point

1 point is deducted for each additional point or incorrect point

Absolute maximum at x = 0

Absolute minimum at x = ±2

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for first point

1 point is earned for second point

1 point is earned for third point

1 point is deducted for each additional point or incorrect point

Absolute maximum at x = 0

Absolute minimum at x = ±2

The student response earns two of the following points:

1 point is earned for first point

1 point is earned for second point

1 point is earned for third point

1 point is deducted for each additional point or incorrect point

Absolute maximum at x = 0

Absolute minimum at x = ±2

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned for first point

1 point is earned for second point

1 point is earned for third point

1 point is deducted for each additional point or incorrect point

Absolute maximum at x = 0

Absolute minimum at x = ±2

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for first point identified

1 point is earned for second point identified

1 point is earned for justification (required on [0,3) only)

1 point is deducted for each additional point or incorrect point

The points of inflection are at x = ±1 because the sign of f″(x) changes at x = 1 and f is even.
descriptions:

1 point is earned for first point identified

1 point is earned for second point identified

1 point is earned for justification (required on [0,3) only)

1 point is deducted for each additional point or incorrect point

The points of inflection are at x = ±1 because the sign of f″(x) changes at x = 1 and f is even.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
3 points are earned for sketch without error

1 point is deducted for each error:

· symmetry

· slopes on [0,3)

· concavity on [0,3)

· discontinuity on [0,3)

· f(0), f(1), f(2) incorrect or extra intercept on [0,3)

Note: No more than 1 point cant be lost in any one category.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

3 points are earned for sketch without error

1 point is deducted for each error:

· symmetry

· slopes on [0,3)

· concavity on [0,3)

· discontinuity on [0,3)

· f(0), f(1), f(2) incorrect or extra intercept on [0,3)

Note: No more than 1 point cant be lost in any one category.

The student response earns one of the following points:

3 points are earned for sketch without error

1 point is deducted for each error:

· symmetry

· slopes on [0,3)

· concavity on [0,3)

· discontinuity on [0,3)

· f(0), f(1), f(2) incorrect or extra intercept on [0,3)

Note: No more than 1 point cant be lost in any one category.

The student response earns two of the following points:

3 points are earned for sketch without error

1 point is deducted for each error:

· symmetry

· slopes on [0,3)

· concavity on [0,3)

· discontinuity on [0,3)

· f(0), f(1), f(2) incorrect or extra intercept on [0,3)

Note: No more than 1 point cant be lost in any one category.
